review.des:
This place is superb, great breakfast and service. Employee hope I get the name right "Tarvis " was an exceptional server and on top of his game. Will definitely return!

Jesus-

Staying in town for a night and found this place on yelp after my original choice for breakfast hit a dead end.

Walked right in no wait on a Wednesday morning around 10am. Sat at the counter and was immediately greeted by the waiter.

Order a Strawberry-Orange juice, finished it within 5 minutes. That thing is delicious. After I made my order the waiter offered me a newspaper while I waited.

Food arrived relatively quick. The waiter immediately gave me options for ketchup and Tabasco and apologized for not having cholula or siracha. The Santa Fe frittata I ordered was good but not great, a bit light on the flavor. Sourdough toast was too thick and chewy.

The food is a 3 but service bumps this restaurant to a 4.

Pretty great breakfast place. I got in on an early Saturday morning before the rush started. This location is really big, plenty of seating just for yourself or a party of 4-6.

They have every kind of breakfast food you can possibly get with all kinds of combinations. I got the Iron Man Omelet. It was pretty good although it was way healthier than I anticipated. The avocados are mixed into the omelet which is fine. It gives it an odd green look to it, but the flavor is not drastically altered or anything.

I have been to 2-3 different Yolk locations.
I want to give them a good review, I really do.
I love breakfast!

However, they always come up short with the flavors on the food or service
This time was the food.

My friend ate lunch as was ok.
I ordered breakfast and was, well
Not so good.

Wow hi I LOVED Yolk.  Our party of 6 was seated after a short wait on a Sunday morning.  Our waiter was very nice and attentive. The cafe is bright and colorful which was perfect and so happy for a sunny Sunday morning.

The food was so good and we weren't left waiting for too long, even though the restaurant was pretty crowded when we were there.  There was a large selection on the menu and plenty of opportunities to create your own omelette, scrambler or skillet.  I got the Smoked Salmon Skillet and LOVED it.  I wish I didn't get full as fast as I did so I could have eaten more of it.  I definitely recommend it.  I love lox and bagels so I was intrigued by this menu item, but wasn't sure how cream cheese, onion, and salmon would be mixed in with scrambled eggs.  Let me tell you, I'm glad I tried it because it was delicious.  It came with a side of capers so you truly get the full experience.  

Next time I'm in Chicago, I would definitely seek out a Yolk location for brunch!

pics.caption: The Smoked Salmon scrambler with breakfast potatoes

review.des:
Apparently when Yolk provides an extra unsanitary gift in the water glass the servers seem to like to give attitude...  worse yet when I wanted to substitute something I was passed off to a new server... I get a dirty glass it happens but please acknowledge it say I am sorry and let me get you a fresh glass... the server offered no apologies and I had to point it out to her twice.. life happens but the way it was handled did effect my experience today.  

As far as the food it was great and the new server was attentive.  This was a great plus...

Great spot in Chicago!! We were looking for a breakfast place that was not in a typical hotel and found Yolk... we got there early for a Saturday which allowed us some time to soak in the cool colors and vibe the place had. We both enjoyed our meals and the service was great! I would stop there again. If you can sit at the counter bar so you see the kitchen.

All the Yolk spots are awesome.......oops wait cept for the one in the train commuter building .....other than them :) service is "consistently" awesome.....food is fresh in all of them.....service is key......

pics.caption: Ok this is a blueberry pancake with some kind of other thing....sorry I can't remember but definitely yes
Corn beef hash with over medium eggsss.....freshly made...

review.des:
My party of 4 arrived around 12 PM. There weren't really a lot of tables, maybe 5-6. However, it took a LONG time for our server to take our order. Mind you, there were also a lot of servers! I've been to Yolk in a different city before, and their service was nothing like this. So that's pretty ridiculous. Tho, I add that their bussers are quick with water and clearing your plates.

The food itself is pretty good, or were we just really hungry? Regardless, we all devoured our food rather quickly. The pancakes, however, are not good. They taste like too much batter and not enough fluffiness. Pass.

Overall, I'd go to Yolk again (in Chicago or in a different city). Hopefully, the service wont be as te

pics.caption: Side of pancakes- not worth it. Get toast instead

review.des:
Went here for breakfast with my family while in Chicago for vacation. It has such a cute aesthetic: blues, yellows, and eggs of course!

I looked forward to the potato pancakes and they did not disappoint! They were perfectly rich and a tad crunchy. The applesauce and sour cream is great on them too. My sisters had crepes and eggs with sausage. The crepes were very good and strawberries were fresh. The sausage! is! amazing! and she got 3 links.

The strawberry orange juice is also delicious and fresh as well!

Thanks for having us :-)

pics.caption: Strawberry - Orange Juice // $12 for a pitcher

review.des:
I stopped into Yolk on friday morning and had a seat at the counter. The server immediately brought me a large glass bottle of water and a glass which I thought was fantastic because who wants to wait on someone else for water when you're thirsty? The service was definitely the highlight of my visit.
For breakfast I ordered the kale scrambler. It was just okay. The home fries could have been a bit crispier and the eggs had a weird texture but the flavors were great. I loved my sourdough toast. Overall, I think Yolk is a great place for a basic breakfast, but would probably try something else next time.

After waiting for an hour on Sunday morning at 10:30am, we were finally seated. First, the person putting our glasses down accidentally broke one on the table. Nbd. He was super apologetic. Then our waiter spilled OJ all over the table and floor. And then he spilled coffee everywhere. Still nbd everyone makes mistakes. Then it took us an entire hour to even place our food and another 40+ mins to get our food. No apologies. Nothing discounted.

On top of everything, our food was not up to par. My cheesy egg sandwich had almost no cheese. My friends croque monsieur egg was completely uncooked where the white part was still clear. Our Nutella pancakes had chocolate syrup instead of Nutella and were 90% empty. Everything had something slightly wrong with it.

Not sure if it was a busy day or the quality's gone down, but not worth the wait. Plenty of smaller brunch places around the area to go to instead!

pics.caption: Don't get the crepes. Chocolate syrup and no Nutella or filling.

review.des:
I LOVE YOLK! If you have not been here, you need to go! This is a Chicago-based breakfast/brunch/lunch place that is sprinkled throughout the Chicagoland area but I have only been to the River North location.

I used to work close to this location and are here frequently before work however I have moved out of the area but whenever I am back in my hometown of Chicago I try to visit.

This is my first time writing a review, but regardless my experience has always been 5 Stars. This recent time my server Rin, was PHENOMENAL! Just enough table touches and very nice and accommodating!

I finally tried the south beach, which is half a pineapple that has been hulled out and the fresh pineapple is diced and mixed with fresh strawberries. The hulled out pineapple is filled with yogurt and their house-made granola then topped with the fresh fruit and nuts. It is heavenly delicious EXCEPT one note- the yogurt is NOT SWEET. I was assuming it would be sweetened vanilla yogurt but no, and the fruit is not sweet enough at this time of year to give me the sweetness I wanted so I had my leftovers at home with honey.

I also wanted something savory and wanted to try one of the small plates too. Luckily they didn't disappoint. The pancake of the month was a potato pancake topped with cheese sour cream and green onions, so I ordered that. They were great and just the savory complement I needed for my South Beach bowl.

If you are ever in Chicago seek out a location of Yolk. Hopefully they will give you phenomenal food and service like my River North location, and with their expansion outside of Illinois I would think this growing chain has got it right at all its locations! Love Yolk!!!!

pics.caption: South Beach bowl with yogurt granola and fresh fruit and nuts
This place is so cute and chic! Love it!

review.des:
Found this place looking on Yelp for a close brunch spot near by my hotel. Looking at the menu, the food was average and a little over priced to my opinion. I ordered the Yolk Breakfast combo with two eggs, two sausages, and 2 strips of bacon. With the combo, I paid additional charge for the berry french toast. The food was alright, nothing special about it. The bacon was a little too crunchy for my liking. The french toast was good, but after a couple bites it was too sweet for me.

My boyfriend got the Iron Man Omelette which consists of egg whites, mushroom, smashed avocado, tomato, onion, green pepper, and a side of salsa. The omelette was really bland and did not have anything special to it as well. The food looked alright, was not too presentable like any other brunch place would be. This spot kind of reminded me of iHop or Denny's from back in New York.

Though the food was mediocre, the service was good. The waitress was really patient and tentative.

I've been to multiple Yolk locations and this one is probably the worst one. The service is terrible and for whatever reason my food always comes out cold. We've been back once or twice and disappointed both times. We probably won't be returning.

Loved loved loved! My husband ordered the chicken and waffles and he loved it. I ordered the red velvet French toast and that was beyond words! The waiter and service was great. Prices are reasonable, def would come back!

I've been here enough times now and keep coming back, this place deserves five stars!  I'm here about once a month, typically with a decent-sized group of girls doing brunch before going to a movie.  Even though we're a fair-sized group for the space, they are always accommodating and never take an attitude.  

Our service has always been great (again, especially with us being a larger group), and on the couple of occasions that we've had stragglers showing up late, they handled it with ease (let us order right away, then just added the newcomers in as needed).  Every time they see our BYOB champagne bottles, they suggest the strawberry OJ (which is delicious!).

We tried the newer Marina City location since it's closer to the theater we always go to, but had some less-than stellar experiences so we started coming back here (plus this one's larger).  

I've always had good meals here, some better than others but never a bad experience.  The tiramisu pancakes were to die for, sweet but not too sweet, and I've had the eggs benedict on multiple occasions and enjoyed them.

This place will easily split checks for you, which is great (another thing we struggled with at the Marina City locale).  For smaller groups you can use the NoWait app to put your name in ahead of time, which is great and I highly recommend.

Two downsides: it gets loud in there (you can still carry on a conversation, but if you're talking to someone more than right next to you you'll have to speak up a bit), and there's not a large waiting area (though that's common for many popular brunch places, they'd rather have room for tables).  On a busy day there will be people waiting outside, which isn't great in the winter.  Overall, though, those are minor and considering how great they've always been otherwise, we plan to keep coming back!

Yolk wasn't our first choice for brunch. Most notably they don't serve cocktails which meant no celebratory mimosas to toast the end of our trip to Chicago. However, Yolk had less than a 10 minutes whereas our other choice had 1 1/2 hour wait. We didn't have time for that so we walked the few blocks to Yolk. Everything was pretty good but nothing was exceptional except for maybe the fresh strawberry orange juice. I had the corn beef hash and a crepe filled with Nutella and topped with strawberries, bananas, whipped cream and a chocolate drizzle. The corn beef was a little over cooked and thus drier than I before. The potatoes also could have had a little more pizazz. The crepe was gorgeous but could of stood a little more Nutella. My companions had chicken and waffles (one topped with a fried egg and both served with sides of syrup and sausage gravy), breakfast nachos, a cinnamon roll, bagel with cream cheese, apple pancakes, bacon, a farmers market omelet, coffee and regular fresh squeezed orange juice. I was told the nachos were a little spicy and they looked disgusting because the sauce had turned the plate to mush (she said it tasted better than it looked). The decor was bright and cheerful and service was decent but not exceptional.

The atmosphere was nice, our waiter was polite and my meal was good. Everything was leading up to 4 stars until I noticed something weird in my fruit bowl. Only the strawberries in my fruit bowl had what appeared to be worms on them. It was disgusting and I don't know how they didn't see it when they put the fruit in the bowl.

Sooooooo good ! My husband had the chicken and waffles. I had the steak and eggs, the steak was medium well and so juicy ! We also had a side of very berry French toast. The blackberries on the toast was the sweetest berries I ever had. We enjoyed our breakfast so much. I will defined will be going back when I'm in Chicago again.
I absolutely love the Santa-fe frittata !!! I definitely recommend it over 100 x's!!!

Still here and wonderful after all these years. Such a friendly, welcoming staff, highly accomodating. This is a great place for breakfast and lunch. I had Eggs Benedict & roasted potatoes- and oldie but goodie. Great for a solitary breakfast, a date, and families. And that's just breakfast! Extensive menu to suit every taste. Love you guys!

pics.caption: Corned beef hash w/2 eggs made to your preference. I'm a sunny-side up kind of lady. Comes w/choice of toast, pancakes, or english muffin.

review.des:
I love breakfast, it's probably one of my favorite meals, 1st or 2nd I would say. Breakfast for dinner? It's so versatile! We decided that we don't get many good brunch/breakfast places where we live so we have to take advantage when we can find one.

The atmosphere is so bright and busy, tons of seating and you can sit at the 'bar' area and watch the cooking happening.

I ordered the Kale Scrambler because I enjoy a good kale with an addition of blueberry lemon pancake! Yum. I love pancakes especially when they taste fresh with blueberries and lemon! Love the taste of it all. I didn't care much for the kale scramble as much as I did the pancakes. Pancakes tasted sweet and the hint of lemon made them even better. He ordered the chicken and waffles, a classic. He enjoyed it but it didn't look as pretty as some others we have seen. Tasty flavors with a crisp chicken and non-soggy waffle.. winning!

Overall, solid breakfast place. If you're in the city for a few days it's a great place to visit!

I went here for the first time with a group of friends and it was pretty standard for brunch. We went on a Sunday morning so I was surprised we were seated right away! I can't help but always get an eggs Benedict for brunch and decided to get the Smoked Salmon eggs Benedict. It was really delicious and the potatoes were also great and very filling. They had sriracha which I always appreciate with my hashbrowns/potatoes. My boyfriend got the Caprese Benedict which I was pleasantly surprised how much I enjoyed! They also were really great with keeping the coffee coming and offered to-go cups for coffee. Overall good brunch spot to have all the standard options you're looking for done well. Nothing out of this world different but reliable with everything!

At the other 2 locations, I've had a wonderful experience. Not so here. We were able to reserve a spot in line thru Yelp...fantastic! And that's where it ended. We were seated in the front of the restaurant near the register and door. We had a view of everything, as did all the customers us. While waiting, some idiot who was in line to pay for his food walked over towards our table, invading our dining space. Excuse us? Did we hover over your table while you were dining?
Next...and what us set me on edge...we were seated before several parties in the same area. They have FINISHED their meals and we are still waiting for ours! We've been waiting for 45 minutes for breakfast!
Our server, Travis, is working at least 3 areas that we can see. He's only swung by our table once since taking our order 30 minutes ago.
Don't know that I'll be back to this location.

Hopped in for breakfast, I ordered the gravy & biscuits w/smothered potatoes. I added mushrooms & onions. I also ordered the sausage links well done. Well the sausage/gravy had a strange flavor to it. I didn't like it, neither did my friend. We both loved the potatoes. The links were just ok. I would go back & try other items. The service was a 4.

A solid breakfast/brunch spot with locations in different neighborhoods. The river north spot is bright and cheery with lots of seating and friendly servers. Corned beef hash is my go-to and it never disappoints. The peppers and onions are always crunchy, the corned beef crispy and lean and the potatoes add the right starch. It comes with two eggs however you want - I like them fried over easy or medium. You can get toast or pancakes as your side. Last time I went, I got the pancakes and they were kind of dry and seemed not cooked to order. Tasty but not their best effort.

The menu is huge with lots of options. One day, I'll break from tradition and try something other than the hash. Worth a visit for not super expensive brunch with very generous portions.

I realize that the name "Yolk" provides fair warning to vegans, but given the size of their menu, I was pretty disappointed with what few options there were for folks like me.  My very extended family was in town for our wedding reception, and Yolk is one of the few places that can accommodate a table for 18, including kids.  

Despite what appeared to be a hundred options, I was able to order dry toast with a side of home fries. That's basically it.  The potatoes were, however, quite tasty.

Would it be so difficult to include ONE tofu scramble or ONE non-dairy yogurt option?  

Whether you want to believe it or not, the statistics prove out that veganism is here to stay and only growing more popular.  In my book, from a business perspective, it's always better to be ahead of the curve than trying to keep up with it.

This is a really awesome place for brunch! You can reserve your spot online, too!

The waiting staff were super friendly and the inside of the restaurant was decorated really cool.

It took me a long time to figure out what I wanted but I ended up getting the protein and eggs combo (bacon, eggs, hashbrowns) and I subbed my side for the cinnamon roll French toast.

This place let's you sub any pancake or French toast for a certain upcharge.

The bacon, eggs and hashbrowns were pretty routine but the cinnamon roll French toast was sooooo good. It tasted just like a cinnamon roll and came with icing on top. No butter or syrup needed!

5. Stars. *****.

Things I love about Yolk:
- Seating is awesome and I can have a conversation without someone sitting on top of me
- Service is outstanding
- Menu is like.... huge
- I've never had a bad meal
- Coffee is good and constantly refilled
- Prices are fine and not outrageous

I've been here twice when visiting chi down and I'd come back here again for sure. Must-try.

After all these years that Yolk has been in Chicago, I had never eaten at one of their locations. They are a little overpriced compared to other breakfast joints, but middle of the week with no one there, it's a solid option for breakfast. The portion size was fantastic. This savory southwest scrambler hit all the right notes for me. From the creaminess of the avocado and sour cream to the acidity of the salsa. Plus you can never go wrong with chorizo in the morning.

pics.caption: El Torero Scrambler // Chorizo sausage, smashed avocado, tomato, jack, cheddar, sour cream. Side of salsa

review.des: Great breakfast place! Service was fast, beware though, the coffee is "bottomless" and you have to pay about $3.00 for it. They didn't let me know this and I just said "sure" when they asked if I wanted some. The food was great, good portions. Nothing absolutely special about this place but I wouldn't mind coming again.

I was there for a Sunday brunch and even though we checked in through Yelp we still had to wait 20 more minutes until we were seated. I didn't mind that our waiter was flirting with my fiance the whole time because we got good and attentive service. The food was meh. I ordered chicken and waffles which smelled like flying oil and wasn't a good dish overall. Nothing really stood out and I left feeling hungry and like I wasted my time and money. I will probably not be back considering all other brunch options nearby.

I love breakfast food and I decided today was the day I branched away from wildberry cafe to expand my horizons. Came here on a Tuesday at 11 AM and there was no wait. I ordered a skillet and it came with pancakes. The skillet was good but one star off because I didn't really like their pancakes. Final verdict: no place can beat wildberry in terms of breakfast.

I would say -  nice breakfast place,  nothing super outstanding but the food was good and the service was great. I was only disappointed by their crapy coffee. Yuck! Also, I asked for a bit non dairy milk and the soy milk they had was definitely old, but I asked for a new cup and the next one was better, but still bad coffee can't be fixed by anything.
I would come back because of the service and food but would definitely get coffee elsewhere.
Had the chunky monkey pancakes and Santa Fe frittata for brunch!!! OMG!!! Both were great.... pancakes super decadent and the frittata was yummy. Great place, and defn worth a visit

THE  YOLK'S  ON  YOU !!

Seriously, this chain of quirky restaurants are fun and unusual. It's clean, professionally managed, with good quality food.

The menu has quite a few different options. Challah bread is even available. Yum. This time I didn't order my traditional smoked salmon omelette, it is immense. A bacon waffle was perfect and served with flair and perfection. I am pretty sure that whatever I order will be perfect. Count on it. Maybe next time I will get the homemade corn beef hash. MMMMMMM.

Chicago, next year I will be back And back at Yolk's!!!

L O O K   F O R  A L L  T H E I R  L O C A T I O N S

Had the west coast crepe. Mix of avocado , mushroom, cheese in sweet crepe. Delicious!

We love the potato more than cheesy grits for sides.

Worst breakfast experience of my life. 45 minute wait for a small overpriced omlete. The waiter forgot our drinks and only stopped by the table 2 times in the 45 minutes it took for our food to be ready they really don't know what they are doing here and the food was pretty bad too.
Pros: Clean toilets
Cons: Everything else

I frequent this location as often as I'm around.

Great staff - always happy with the service. They are very friendly. Sarah is great.

The portions are great for big appetites. I order the 5 egg omelette most of the time and it's always consistent. The pancakes are delicious and if you like potato pancakes, they are a must try. On occasion I'll get corned beef hash and it's one of the top. The coffee is excellent as well.

Every time we come here it is packed ! But we always get seated right away ! The same server is soo nice and we get her every time !!! The food is sooo goood ! And we don't ever wait too long for our food !  this yolk is my favorite location ! . Keep it up guys !!!! By the way you guys have some cute guys working there :) wink wink lmao
Breakfast was good the omelette wasn't as great as It normally is but It was good. I had the turkey sausage omelette with cheese. Nothing too fancy. Service was great from the staff.

A great brunch place but beware of going on the weekends for the long wait! It's usually less than hour. Today I came on a Friday morning and luckily it was fairly empty. Service is fairly quick and refilled our coffee pretty fast.
I got the Santa Fe frittata and it is one of my favorite dishes from here! There's a lot of ingredients, so you get a bunch of flavors. It comes with a nice salsa to add a nice kick. My favorite part however was the side of red velvet French toast. Its always so good each time and it has cream cheese frosting inside. Definitely worth getting.

pics.caption: Red velvet French toast with syrup!
Santa Fe frittata with salsa and sour cream!

review.des:
We found this place on looking for a good brunch spot. It was perfect after a night out of drinking. We got there around 1130 and were able to get a table for five within 15 minutes.

Our waiter, Tarves, gave great recommendations. Including the strawberry-orange juice and the red velvet French toast. it's BYOB and I wish we knew that sooner!!! The menu includes a variety of options so finding something to eat is easy. The portions are on the larger side. I left half of my pancakes untouched. The meals are definitely sharable.

The staff was attentive and everyone was available to help. No servers or staff tried to  avoid you.

Bathrooms were clean and well maintained.

This is a solid breakfast/brunch/easy lunch option. I love their omelette especially! But they have a great  variety of healthy and more decadent options. With locations all over the city, I've been to a few and they're all fairly consistent in my experience. I was just recently here and our sever, Greg, provided stellar service. Despite being slammed their staff is super efficient and calm like they do this everyday, probably cuz they do.

Pro tip, if you're going during prime breakfast/brunch time you can see the air time and even add yourself in line through the Nowait app!

The bagel sandwich was delicious as were the cheesy grits.  The coffee was too bitter and weak for my liking  though.
No wait to be seated on the Sunday morning we went.
A pleasant experience overall.

Came to this place on a recommendation of a friend. When I looked at their menu and saw their omelette were 5 eggs, I did not feel like eating something that I pictured very big on my mind but after asking the question to the waitress with her saying that the omelette aren't that big of a size at all I right away ordered the California Omelette. It was great and very fresh as well as everything else home fries and all, I left there eating a satisfied breakfast. The place is nice and very clean and the service was great

In a city w/high expectations when eating out, Yolk is basically Chicago's Denny's. Not great, but certainly not bad. Good coffee is definitely a plus. Most recently got the crepe, which in theory was an interesting mixture of savory and sweet, but in reality was a bad idea, as it was just a strange combination of flavors and poorly executed crepe.

Nothing on the plate made me say wow but I can say that I'd return again. To be fair I ordered a very plain dish. The iron man omelette. Egg whites and veggies. Served with grilled potatoes. It was served with a fresh and bright green salsa that made me feel like I was eating from a taco truck in Texas. It was awesome! I went on rush breakfast hour Saturday morning on a holiday weekend. So for being slammed the food was fast and served neatly. I like the effort! Download the app no wait and knock 55 minutes off the hot wait. We walked right in. Slopes the line. Waited 3 minutes and was seated immediately!

pics.caption: Iron man omelette seasoned potatoes with salsa verde!

review.des:
Brunch meal:

As soon as you get seated, someone comes with a cup of coffee, which made me think it was free. It's actually $3 for bottomless coffee (not bad but I wish it was advertised before).

The meal portions are huge and you'll definitely get filled up. However, the poached eggs were not at all runny. The corned beef hash and eggs was fine, but some type of garnish would've made it taste a lot better.

Pro tip: always get the extra side of pancakes if it comes with your dish. The "side" includes two pancakes that are big enough to fill you up.

Yolk is a straightforward breakfast restaurant in River North. They offer omelets, frittatas, eggs benny in a variety of forms, and of course basic fare likes eggs with protein. It is a step up from a dinner, but is remains unpretentious in the crowded Chicago brunch scene.

The high rating is a mystery to me: food is Ok. Potatoes too salty. Caprese Benny is good but nothing remarkable. Eggs were poached soft but that is expected. My English muffin was slightly burned (black) around the edges. I don't understand why the dish received rave review.

Service is good initially but slowed down after food arrived. Restaurant was at most 30 percent full 9am - 9:30 am Friday. Food was served within about 15 minutes.

Coffee was very hot. However, it taste a bit too acidic. Only creamers were provided for coffee.

The dining room design is a simple and bright. My table was wobbly making it hard to cut the English muffin without spilling the coffee.

Not sure if I would return.

pics.caption: Caprese Benny with sauce on the side (about 1/8 on top ), $12.50

review.des:
First time at Yolk and loved it. Everyone was friendly and attentive.

Had the most delicious Croque Madame made with Challah French toast. You have to try the strawberry orange juice! Very yummy. Got the seasoned potatoes that were so good alone that I felt a little guilty for putting ketchup on them.
Friendly and energetic staff.  Extensive brunch menu- something (always delicious) for everyone!  CONSISTENT!!!

Really liked the food on my first visit which I was eagerly anticipating, as a huge fan of breakfast food! I can't wait to come back. Giving a 5 stars for what it is trying to be...even though the service toward end of their shift got a tad inattentive. Had the works 5 egg omelette and subbed upcharge the regular pancake it comes with for the nutty monkey or something... chocolate banana and peanut butter. It was awesome, and the omelette was very tasty. Food was great!

Yummy! This place was so busy Sunday morning for brunch. Generally a good sign for a good place to be. They are excellent at keeping things moving and we only waited about 15min for our table. Their food selection is excellent, I literally wanted to try everything on the menu, but I can't eat that much so I settled for the south beach, half a pineapple with house made yogurt, pineapple, granola, nuts, and strawberries. Just what I needed after a weekend of not so healthy eating! Everything was fresh and wonderful, our server did an excellent job, even though he was clearly slammed, and the food did not disappoint. I'm not usually one for trying interstate chain restaurants when I'm in a new city, but I would definitely go here again.

Came here for breakfast after arriving in Chicago on a Friday morning. We were looking forward to a nice breakfast after a 3 hour flight and a train ride into the city. Apparently we were lucky we got a seat because this place is pretty popular. There's huge glass windows in the front of the restaurant so you can have a view of the city while you eat. I ordered the red velvet french toast. It was amazing! Our server was very friendly and attentive. I will definitely return when I'm in Chicago in the future.

The food was so good: I had the kale egg scramble, cheesy grits, pancakes, strawberry OJ and hot coffee. My husband had the chicken and waffles with sausage gravy. We were both very full and satisfied. The place was busy so we had a 15m wait and it was worth it. The waitstaff was very friendly!
I love the Iron Man omelette and the multi-grain pancakes (make sure you ask for them well-done).   Only downsides: noisy, the wait for a table.  Super cute (and attentive) servers!! Ask for Brooke.

Eggs and grits were very good; and the coffee was good too. The wait was long and the service was slow, probably 30-40 minutes to get our food after ordering. I ordered steak & eggs and I ordered it medium well. The steak was so bloody that the plate looked like a crime scene photo. As the blood mixed with my eggs & grits, my appetite faded.  Even my wife (med rare person) could not deal with it.

The waiter and the cashier both asked if everything was ok, when I shared my experience they just shrugged. Why ask?

I was really excited to eat here due to the great reviews. However I was disappointed. Although the service was great and we were seated with no wait, the food was a let down. I ordered the chilaquiles + red velvet French toast. The red velvet French toast was sickeningly sweet and didn't have much complexity to it. Underwhelmed. The chilaquiles lacked flavor and love. My son got the kids Mac and cheese which was allegedly elbow macaroni and four cheeses. It looked EXACTLY LIKE Kraft macaroni and cheese out the box. I'm 99.9% positive that that's what I paid $6 for. I ordered a latte which was not great but not terrible. I won't be back.

I have been to this location many times, today was by far the worst experience ever. Maybe it was an off day but really put a bad taste in my mouth. Got something really simple ( two eggs with potatoes and pancakes) eggs were over cooked, potatoes were cold and not seasoned and pancakes tasted like cardboard.  My boyfriend got the Chicken and Waffles and he was not impressed (he said they tried) This was his first time to Yolk based of my raving reviews. Maybe because it was towards the end of the day but that's no excuse. Should have known would be bad.. Cardi B was blasting from the speakers.

Solid brunch, quick service. I arrived with a party of 5 for brunch (11:30am) on Memorial Day and we had to have our whole party present before being seated. They actually weren't that packed compared to another location I've been to. We were seated right away and didn't wait more than 15-20 min for all our food to come out! I liked the variety and it's nice that you can have crepes over pancakes with your dish. I ordered the breakfast wrap and the seasoned potatoes on the side were really really good! I didn't think the salsa was anything special though - there wasn't much flavor to it. It was a simple salsa verde. But the waitress was kind enough to take our table picture and everyone enjoyed their food!
Yolk will be my spot every time I visit Chicago!  The food, service, and the atmosphere was great! When you visit Chicago make sure you stop by Yolk.

I have to start by saying boy, do I love eggs- like really, love eggs. And I love me some runny yolk best of all. I'm down for egg yolks any meal of the day.

So naturally I did a double take when I saw a restaurant named "Yolk". "Those are my people," I thought to myself. "I have to go eat there."

I convinced my travel buddies to dine here for breakfast. I ordered the South Eggs Benedict- two poached eggs with chorizo and cheesy grits on the side.

Everyone's plates arrived and looked amazing. I couldn't wait to dig in...

To two mostly cooked "poached eggs". The consistency was more like a soft boiled egg- tender, but no chance of running. My heart was broken but not my yolks. Perhaps a fluke? But no- two of my companions also ordered other eggs Benedict dishes, and fared only slightly better than me; each had one mostly cooked egg, one actually poached/runny.

The non-Benny eaters enjoyed their food, which included the chicken and waffle, skillet, and an omelet.

But 2 out of 6 eggs done right at a place called Yolk? No thanks. Kinda scarred, won't be back (for yolks at least).

Searching for a breakfast place while in Chicago and we passed up a few. So glad we did.

We ordered the chicken and waffles and the Yolk combo. They were huge, fast, hot, and fresh.

Service was quick and friendly - took no time at all to get us seated and to take both drink and food orders.

Will return when we're back in town!
Excellent breakfast. When we arrived they had 20 people ahead of us but it only took about 20 minutes. Coffee was excellent and the food was very good.

There's a lot of brunch places in Chicago that get a lot of hype (I'm looking at you, Wildberry) but this one is my favorite. Everything on the menu is delicious and the staff are willing to help with any questions about menu items! Their biscuits were super yummy and the cinnamon roll pancakes were so, so good. Everyone loved their food and left absolutely stuffed! Can't wait to come back to this place the next time I'm in town!

Best thing about Yolk? They offer combo plates with both sweet & savory items! Never again will you have to deliberate over a breakfast of carbs or protein, French toast or eggs. They let you have both! Why doesn't every breakfast place do this? The Yolk Street combo was perfect: 2 eggs, sausage, bacon, and French toast or pancakes. The best of all worlds.

I will say, the French Toast was just okay- definitely on the dry side (don't you hate it when it's just a piece of dry bread with an eggy coating?). But still happy that I got my carbs & protein in one sitting.  

Service was fantastic for our very large group. Food came out fast and coffee refills were a'flowing.  Definitely a breakfast hot spot for good reason.

pics.caption: Very berry French toast...not super moist slices, but good toppings
Yolk combo breakfast (with French toast on a separate plate).

review.des:
Most breakfast/diner spots are pretty much the same, and this place falls right in line with the rest of them.  Nothing unique or enticing on the menu; pretty much the same old, same old.  Don't get me wrong, the food is cooked well and the flavor is pretty average.  You can probably label this as a step or two above IHOP but a step below other unique breakfast/brunch spots in the city.

I went the safe route and ordered the Chicken and Waffles, this was really good and I would highly suggest this dish as it is slightly different than the normal Chicken and Waffle that you are pretty much used to.

I've gone to this Yolk and the one in the Oglivie Train Station and both location has the same kind of fun and light vibe.  I would definitely go to Yolk again.

I came here on a Friday afternoon with my friends. It was pretty awesome to get parking right in front of the restaurant at that time. The service here was pretty quick, and the waitress we had was very attentive. The whole restaurant is clean and feels very spacious.

I got the iron man omelette, which was really refreshing and light to eat because of the egg whites and mashed avocado. I think this is a great place for brunch because there's so many menu options that'll satisfy any sweet or savory craving. It was my second time here, but I'd definitely want to visit again in the future!

pics.caption: Iron Man Omelette w/ salsa & diced red potatoes

review.des:
No Yolk about it...this place catered a mighty fine breakfast at a recent business conference I attended. The star of the show? The bacon and crepes!

When I typically think about breakfast delivery, I expect soggy and cold food, but not with Yolk. They even managed to preserve the toast to perfection. A lovely fruit variety that included pineapple and oranges was served--not the pre-cut fruit casserole mixture with grapes and takeover "melon filler" (quoted by one of my coworkers). The bacon was thick and oh-so-flavorful I wanted to eat the entire batch, but I resisted out of love for my team. The scrambled eggs were thick and filling, and the potato cubes were deliciously crispy. But...the crepes served with fresh blueberries and blackberries were the star of the show for me. I hope my coworkers aren't reading this, because I selfishly took two...shhhh.

In the end I was so full I barely made it through the next presentation. I can only imagine how good breakfast right from the kitchen must be. For now, I'll just enjoy reading through all the great reviews ;-)

SERVICE: Every time I come here, the service is friendly and fast.

FOOD: It is of my opinion that breakfast is hard to mess up, so the food here is as good as one might expect. The food options are plentiful, ranging from red velvet French toast to 5 egg omelettes and bacon waffles.

I've tried their oatmeal here before and it was very thick and good.

The OJ is fresh, and I like the way they use small rounded ice in their drinks. Not that I put ice in my OJ, I'm not a savage.

ATMOSPHERE: The seating area is pretty open with choices of ""bar" seating, tables, and booths. This place is pretty casual and is less than five minutes from the brown line/purple line.

pics.caption: Big fat Greek Omelette and the Red Velvet French Toast

review.des:
This spot reminds me of First Watch in Florida. It's a breakfast spot but I don't feel much of a vibe.

The service was fabulous, truly enjoyed our server but the meal wasn't entirely memorable.

The latte was in a coffee cup so it was tiny. Maybe I am spoiled by large, grand lattes at breakfast spots but it just didn't justify the size to price ratio for me.

I went for the South Beach which was a 1/2 pineapple filled w/ goodies: strawberries, yogurt, granola, and walnuts. While it was presented beautifully with a #FoodPorn stature, it just didn't deliver for me. I felt like the pineapple pieces were overwhelming to the rest of the plate and there wasn't enough yogurt or granola.

Overall is was okay but not sure I would return quickly.

Yolk is a decent brunch spot. The servers are friendly and food is good. It's not the best brunch I've ever had but it was decent. I requested a beverage that wasn't on their menu but thought it'd be pretty simple for them to make. They made it and they made it PERFECT! So good! It was an iced vanilla chai tea latte with almond milk. Sounds simple, however, the waiter looked at me like a deer in headlights. It was so cute. He paused and put the order in right away because he didn't want to forget it. I appreciated that. I ordered the red velvet French toast which has the cream filling. I love sweets but even for me it became too sweet after awhile, so I couldn't finish it. Fair warning. It's also helpful that you can put yourself on a waiting list via the Yelp app being that some locations wait times get crazy.

On day 3 of our trip we visited Yolk and, well, we were not overly impressed.  It was ok but certainly did not meet expectations and was no where near the level of food as Wildberry or Little Goat.  Service was good, but food lacked that yummy flavor we were looking for.  I wouldn't go back.

We came here for brunch on Saturday, April 17 and about 4 hours later four out of the six of us were sick throwing up within minutes of each other. This was the only thing we had eaten that day. 12 hours later were all fine, no more sign of any illness. We got food poisoning.

I called today to talk to the manager and let him know and he was very rude and unsympathetic on the phone. Having no possible concern at all about this and not believing we had food poisoning because we didn't go to the hospital.

Would never go here again.

I came here on a Mother's Day afternoon and was surprised to find that we were seated right away.
The menu had lots of exciting brunch selections and it was really hard to choose. I decided on the chicken and waffle with an extra egg (+$1) on top.
Our server was very friendly and service was great overall. The restaurant is very loud and busy.
I was with a group of 9 people, but we ended up having to split due to the lack of seating for large groups.
Food came out fast overall and the portions were huge!
I had a hard time finishing my entire plate and left with a big food belly.
I would definitely want to come back again to try other items on their menu!

It is what it is.  IHOP-style place, but not quite as trashy.

VERY loud.  Cracker Barrel status there.  The food is "okay", but for the price you can find a lot better and more interesting breakfast options at many of the cafes around Chicago.

I don't see myself going back, I just heard some hype about it and decided to give it a shot.
Service was nice and we were seated in cozy booth. We had ordered the hash brown, blueberry pancakes, eggs and strawberry OJ. Food is good if you are looking for a quick bite for a reasonable price.

Cheap food. BYOB. Extremely fast seating. Accommodates big groups. Splitting payments is never an issue. Great location to access other parts of the city...If all this doesn't set the scene for a good brunch...I dont what does.

We came here for brunch and we were not disappointed. After reading through reviews, we knew we had to come here. There wasn't any wait when we got there which was a plus but it was a busy restaurant. We got the corned beef hash with perfectly poached eggs on top. We couldn't decide on pancakes vs French toast so decided on both! The red velvet French toast was amazing with swirls of cream cheese! We also had the nutty money cakes which is a must for any peanut butter lovers! We will definitely be back for more.
Solid breakfast places for eggs, pancakes and most things in between. Service is quick - you've gotta try their special hot sauce.

I came to chicago to visit my cousin and we went to yolk for breakfast and the food was amazing. I had the nutella crepes with 2 eggs, bacon, and sausage. It was delicious. The service was really good.

Excellent brunch spot!  Food was great. Nothing super out of the ordinary but they had all the brunch staples and large portions. We went here expecting a pretty long wait but got seated right away on a Sunday at 11am.

I've been here, and at other Yolks before. They have a variety of Pancakes and French toast.  They  do not sub plain toast for pancakes!  Im not a fan of their potatoes. Their little cubes.  They do the Biz though. They have lots of healthy Options too. The food is good. They wait is always 20 minutes or so. It's in a convenient location  next to the "L" Red Line. They give you coffee to go. You need it to stay warm!

I really wish I could give a 4.75 because the grits glitch wasn't really major - half of the bowl was a solid mass rather creamy - in the face of the rest of the wonderful meal.  My companion had pot roast eggs Benedict with a single side banana chocolate pancake and was very pleased. I had west coast (veggie scrambled eggs) crepes,  cheesy grits, and a single piece of very berry French toast. It was Great! Although it was crowded when we arrived the wait was relatively short, and the professional staff never made us feel rushed. Our eyes were a little bigger than out tummies so we had good leftovers. One comment - if something sounds crazy rich or overly sweet it probably is. Egg battered red velvet cake with mounds of syrupy strawberries with whipped cream -- yeah . . .  I love this place!

Super cute but a little overrated. I came here because of the Yelp reviews but I wouldn't say it's four stars. We went around 11 and got seated right away which was nice. I got the croque madame and it was super filling and had me stuffed for almost the rest of the day. The potatoes I had were a little under done but the sandwich made up for it so I guess it evened out. Aside from food, the place was really cute and the service was great. Our waitress was very sweet and even gave me a to go cup with a coffee refill! Not sure if I'd be back but it definitely wasn't a bad experience at all. Decent and pretty average breakfast spot overall.

pics.caption: Potatoes were a little underdone but still decent meal overall

review.des: Food and service was excellent as always.  I would hesitate on the ham steak.   Flavor was excellent and quality good, it was just a bit cold.

This was our reward after working the Chicago Marathon.

Breakfast and lunch are served in the morning, so I opted for the buffalo chicken salad with coffee. The buffalo chicken salad had some kick and the lettuce was quality. Good portion.

Coffee was good and refilled often.

Pleasant and attentive service.

I have to visit Yolk once or twice every time I visit the Windy City. There's only good to say about my experiences there. The food, coffee, and service are always good. Somehow, it has gotten past me that they have their own hot sauce. I tried it this time. Take a bottle home! It's outstanding!

I've been at this location (which mind you gets super packed) twice, and this isn't a bad breakfast spot in Chi-town for the price.

They have a decent amount of breakfast options which are both sweet (french toast, pancakes), and savory (omelettes, chicken & waffles).  On my recent second visit, I ended up having a little Yolk date by myself at the bar.   My merry accompaniments: bottomless coffee, the California omelette with jalapenos, a huge bottle of Cholula hot sauce and pancakes.

The food & service are generally great, but I will take a star off on the flavor of the omelette - it was so bland I had to drench it in loads of hot sauce.

Anyway, definitely a safe and inexpensive option for breakfast!

Excellent service!! The food was awesome. I had been in Chicago for 2 days and friends, locals and tourist kept recommending this place . We decided to check it out and it was awesome well worst it.

Thank you

Great place to grab a hearty breakfast at a reasonable price. I got the combo. Two eggs, 2 sausages,2 slices of bacon and 2 pancakes. I was concerned that I would be late for a spa appointment. However my food was prepared quickly. My waitress was attentive even though she was also serving a large table of  CPD officers.

I was here for brunch with a friend and, first off, no reservations - but also no line, when we arrived around 12:30. I hate, hate, hate waiting for food (probably because I always wait until I'm already hungry to start thinking about it).

We split the breakfast combo platter and the chicken and waffle. This is the first place I've been where the chicken was deboned, which made the eating experience much easier, but also slightly less delicious. I'm a traditional kind of girl, and you just can't get as much crunch on a deboned chicken breast as you can at KFC, I'm sorry.

For that reason, I'm going to have to chop you.

That's a joke, I'll probably be back. The thing about Yolk, though, is that the the menu is so big and everything sounds so delicious that I keep telling myself, "Next time I come back - I'll find it. My perfect breakfast." Hasn't happened yet, but I'll probably keep trying.

This place did NOT disappoint. And when you come visit as a New Yorker, these prices do not disappoint either. It was very spacious and my party of 2 did not have to worry about making a reservation at all when we went on Friday right before noon. We both were very complicated with our orders, but our waitress was REALLY patient and answered all our questions. The only thing that could have been better was when I ordered the combo, I could only substitute the bacon with all turkey sausages (which will now come with 4 instead of the 2). I wish there were more options such as ham, home fries, etc., but because it was the combo, there couldn't be changes made. The sweet crepes I upgraded to (nutella) were amazing as well (though the little chopped nuts on top tasted a little stale) and I was very surprised with the portions. I thought everything would be less since it was a big combo, but nope! Had two crepes, four turkey sausages, two eggs, and added smashed avocado on the side for less than a dollar extra. The cinnamon roll was also massive enough to split between two people, but I would say it wasn't that impressive unless you're absolutely craving that specifically. Lucky for Chi dwellers, there are multiple spots as this is a chain so it certainly makes it easier to access regardless which neighborhood you are coming from.
Ordered delivery to our office. They forgot part of the order. I called and spoke to the manager who said he'd credit me the cost plus delivery fee and yet didn't.

Awesome food! Not overly expensive. Good service. Can't go wrong.

We came by at 2pm for a late breakfast. Great place for brunch.

Ate here for a birthday breakfast & we managed to arrive right before the Saturday rush (9/10 AM). I was pleasantly surprised to find flavored creamers even though it made it difficult to stop drinking coffee. The egg dish was huge (5-egg omelet!!) but so, so filling & full of flavor!

Awesome breakfast spot! The portions are huge and I love that the place has plenty of seating. My sister got the French toast with the berries and it was delicious. I opted for the works omelette with a side of fruit- also great. The omelette was perfectly cooked but given the large portion, I could only finish half of it (thankfully I had help finishing it so it didn't go to waste).

I wished I lived locally so I could come back more often but I'm from California. Awesome breakfast spot and if you get the chance, definitely check it out!

pics.caption: The works omelette with side of fruit.
